conclusion: Analyze the area under the curves of the v-t graph to determine the initial distance.
Car A starts at 25 m/s and ends at 0 m/s; Car B starts at 15 m/s and ends at 0 m/s.
Car A stops completely in 30 seconds; Car B stops completely in 25 seconds; they just avoided collision at 20 seconds.
Calculate the distance traveled by Car A using the formula for distance under constant acceleration.
Car A travels 250 meters in 20 seconds.
Calculate the distance traveled by Car B using the formula for distance under constant acceleration.
Car B travels 150 meters in 20 seconds.
The initial distance between the cars is the difference in the distances traveled by both cars.
The initial distance between the two cars was 100 meters.
The initial distance between Car A and Car B was 100 meters.
